name: ScopeEvent
comment: Injected into the listener function within angular/angular-core.Scope.on to provide event-specific details to the scope listener.

data.name: data
data.comment: Data attached to the event. This would be the optional parameter from angular/angular-core.RootScope.emit and angular/angular-core.RootScope.broadcast.

name.name: name
name.comment: The name of the intercepted scope event.

targetScope.name: targetScope
targetScope.comment: The origin scope that triggered the event (via broadcast or emit).

currentScope.name: currentScope
currentScope.comment: The destination scope that intercepted the event. As the event traverses the scope hierarchy the the event instance stays the same, but the angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.currentScope reflects the scope of the current listener which is firing.

defaultPrevented.name: defaultPrevented
defaultPrevented.comment: true or false depending on if angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.preventDefault was executed.

propagationStopped.name: propagationStopped
propagationStopped.comment: true or false depending on if angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.stopPropagation was executed.

constructors.comment: angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.ScopeEvent-.name - The name of the scope event. angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.ScopeEvent-.targetScope - The destination scope that is listening on the event.

stopPropagation.name: stopPropagation
stopPropagation.comment: Prevents the intercepted event from propagating further to successive scopes.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of angular/angular-core.ScopeEvent.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
